quote: Henry Youngman:When I read about the evils of drinking, I gave up reading.
Johnny Carson:I know a man who gave up smoking, drinking, sex, and rich food. He was healthy right up to the day he killed himself.
Frank Sinatra:I feel bad for people who don’t drink. When they wake up in the morning, that’s as good as they’re going to feel all day.
Homer Simpson:To alcohol! The cause of – and solution to – all of life’s problems.
William Butler Yeats:The problem with some people is that when they aren't drunk they're sober.
H.L. Mencken:24 hours in a day. 24 beers in a case. Coincidence? I think not.
George Bernard Shaw:Alcohol is the anesthesia by which we endure the operation of life.
Finley Peter Dunne:Alcohol is necessary for a man so that he can have a good opinion of himself, undisturbed be the facts.
Leo Durocher:To some it's a six-pack. To me it's a Support Group.
Winston Churchill:Always remember that I have taken more out of alcohol than alcohol has taken out of me.
W.C. Fields:I never drink water because of the disgusting things that fish do in it.
Humphrey Bogart:The problem with the world is that everyone is a few drinks behind.
Oscar Wilde:Work is the curse of the drinking classes.
Plato:He was a wise man who invented beer.
Professor Irwin Corey:Remember 'I' before 'E', except in Budweiser.
Dean Martin:You're not drunk if you can lie on the floor without holding on.
W.C. Fields:A woman drove me to drink and I didn't even have the decency to thank her.
Ernest Hemingway:I drink to make other people more interesting.
George Burns:It takes only one drink to get me drunk.....the trouble is, I can't remember if it's the thirteenth or the fourteenth.
Winston Churchill:A lady came up to me one day and said 'Sir! You are drunk', to which I replied 'I am drunk today madam, and tomorrow I shall be sober but you will still be ugly.
W.C. Fields:I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.
Dorothy Parker:I like to have a martini, two at the very most. After three I'm under the table, after four I'm under my host.
Ernest Hemingway:Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut
Richard Braunstein:The hard part about being a bartender is figuring out who is drunk and who is just stupid.
Benjamin Franklin:Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
Al Bundy:Pretty women make us buy beer. Ugly women make us drink beer.
Benjamin Franklin:In wine there is wisdom, in beer there is freedom, in water there is bacteria.
Drew Carey:Oh, you hate your job? Why didn't you say so? There's a support group for that. It's called EVERYBODY, and they meet at the bar.
Frank Sinatra:Alcohol may be man's worst enemy, but the bible says love your enemy.
W.C. Fields:Everybody's got to believe in something. I believe I'll have another beer.
Alex Levin:Only Irish coffee provides in a single glass all four essential food groups: alcohol, caffeine, sugar and fat.
W.C. Fields:Fell in love with a beautiful blonde once. Drove me to drink. And I never had the decency to thank her.
Tommy Cooper:I’m on a whisky diet. I’ve lost three days already.
Dean Martin:If you drink, don’t drive. Don’t even putt.
Raymond Chandler:There is no bad whiskey. There are only some whiskeys that aren’t as good as others.
Quentin R. Bufogle:99% of all problems can be solved by money - and for the other 1% there's alcohol.
Mitch Ratcliffe:A computer lets you make more mistakes faster than any other invention with the possible exceptions of handguns and Tequila.
Irwin Shaw:I never drink while I'm working, but after a few glasses I get ideas that would never have occurred to me dead sober.
Winston Churchill:Remember gentleman, it’s not just France we’re fighting for, it’s Champagne!
W. C. Fields:I don't drink anymore, on the other hand I don't drink any less either.
George Carlin:One tequila, two tequila, three tequila, floor.
David Lee Roth:I used to jog, but the ice cubes kept falling out of my glass.
Noel Coward:Why do I drink Champagne for breakfast? Doesn't everyone?
